title: 820-3115: 0 Ohm short on PP5V_S3
message:
History: Likely water damage, but cleaned before repair :(

Any suggestions on finding the short? Power supply maxed out at 0.1V/3.5A.
Tried 3 AA bateries in series supplying ±6A (voltage assumed 4.5V). But nothing gets hot except the batteries :)

title: 820-3115: 0 Ohm short on PP5V_S3
message:
The batteries won't work as their internal resistance is too high so they will heat up instead of the board.

Judging by your power supply it is a "hard" short to GND so I think you are looking at a short in the board or someone messed with it and bridged something together.

title: 820-3115: 0 Ohm short on PP5V_S3
message: Ok thanks Duke. Just needed someone to confirm. I'll just send it back to the customer as-is.

title: 820-3115: 0 Ohm short on PP5V_S3
message: Give it a good look over, I bet someone messed with it and shorted out 5V with solder.

title: 820-3115: 0 Ohm short on PP5V_S3
message: Nope, couldn't find it. Thanks anyway.
